title: PTD Today — Media
disclaimer: Informational only — AI-generated summaries; may contain errors. Verify with the original video.

ai.summary: Based on the available description, Daniel Tom, 31, owns and operates Bay Area Sanitation, which runs a fleet of almost 2,000 portable toilets serving construction sites and events across the San Francisco Bay Area. The company reported $4.3 million in total income in 2025.
bullets: Owner: Daniel Tom, 31
Company: Bay Area Sanitation
Fleet size: almost 2,000 portable toilets
Service area: construction sites and events across the San Francisco Bay Area
2025 total income: $4.3 million
takeaways: This is a concrete data point on the scale of local essential-service vendors in the Bay Area—useful when mapping regional supplier capacity.
Nearly 2,000 units indicate sizeable fleet logistics to consider when evaluating local infrastructure and vendor coordination.
$4.3M in reported income (2025) provides a baseline for gauging market size and commercial viability of sanitation services in the region.
Coverage of construction sites and events signals the types of temporary-service demand present in the local economy.

items.title: Zip Up, Clip In, Copilot On

ai.summary: Based on the available description… The video shows Jo discovering how Copilot Groups can simplify route planning. It presents Microsoft Copilot and AI as tools that make route planning easier.
bullets: Focuses on route planning made easy.
Jo discovers the capabilities of Copilot Groups.
Positions Copilot Groups as a planning tool.
References Microsoft Copilot and AI.
Includes hashtags: #copilot #microsoftcopilot #ai
takeaways: If route planning is part of your operations, Copilot Groups are presented as a tool worth exploring.
Consider piloting Copilot Groups with a small routing or coordination team to evaluate fit with your workflows.
Evaluate how Microsoft Copilot integrates with existing systems and processes before broader adoption.

items.title: Audyt w erze AI: praktyczne zastosowania i realne korzyści | Katarzyna Chojniak, Alicja Barska

ai.summary: Based on the available description, podcast hosts from KPMG discuss how AI is already integrated into audit work, supporting repetitive tasks, analysing full populations of data and enabling more informed decisions. They describe practical tools (AI Transaction Scoring Tool, Clara AI, KPMG Clara and Clara for Clients), the shift from sampling to full-population analysis, changing auditor roles and competencies, plus implementation challenges like data security and regulation.
bullets: AI Transaction Scoring Tool enables analysis of entire data populations rather than sampling.
Clara AI acts as a conversational assistant with specialised agents to support auditors.
KPMG Clara platform provides real-time audit management; Clara for Clients modernises client communication.
AI supports documentation and disclosure analysis while changing auditors' roles and required competencies.
Key implementation issues include data security, regulatory environment and adaptation challenges.
takeaways: Expect audits to become more comprehensive as AI enables full-population analysis rather than sampling.
Ensure high-quality, accessible data—AI-driven tools depend on complete, well-structured datasets.
Prioritise data security and regulatory compliance when sharing audit-relevant information.
Prepare for more real-time interaction with auditors via platforms like KPMG Clara and improved client communication.
Invest in staff skills to work effectively with AI assistants and analytics-driven audit processes.

items.title: Arknights: Endfield | 4K NVIDIA DLSS 4 Launch Trailer

ai.summary: Based on the available description… Arknights: Endfield has officially launched and the trailer spotlights NVIDIA DLSS 4 with Multi Frame Generation. Footage was captured on a GeForce RTX 5080 at 4K Ultra settings using DLSS 4 Multi Frame Generation 4X Mode, with links to the game and social channels provided.
bullets: Official launch trailer for Arknights: Endfield, a 3D real-time strategy RPG.
Highlights NVIDIA DLSS 4 with Multi Frame Generation.
Captured on GeForce RTX 5080 at 4K Ultra Settings using DLSS 4 Multi Frame Generation 4X Mode.
Description includes links to the game site and developer/publisher social channels.
Released by NVIDIA GeForce on 2026-01-21.
takeaways: Trailer demonstrates use of NVIDIA DLSS 4 Multi Frame Generation in a commercial game launch.
Source footage was produced using a GeForce RTX 5080 at 4K Ultra with DLSS 4 4X Mode, a data point for high-performance capture workloads.
For organizations evaluating infrastructure for similar AI-driven rendering or 4K capture tasks, the RTX 5080 and DLSS 4 are presented as the hardware/software used in this example.
